intro: Waltheria collina, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Waltheria collina is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
